result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin J Hole was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceratjion Program
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 507 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  May be taken out of prison wages/trust accounts.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow throught with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with the victims family except with their approval/permission.

Exhibit #2 From Motion Hearing Held on 07/08/15 - Destroyed pursuant to statute.

Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: February 12, 2016 Sentencing Hearing, filed by Linda Coleman, court reporter.

Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kevin J Hole in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Victim's mother and sister presented statements to the court.
Defendant's sister presented statements to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  10 Years.
Initial Confinement:  5 Years.
Extended Supervision: 5 Years.
507  Days Credit.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with victims family accept with their approval/permission.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence (can be taken out of prison wages/trust accounts).

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


Defendant to be transferred to DCI - FORTHWITH.
Sentencing memorandum filed by State Public Defender.

Defendant Kevin J Hole in court, in custody, with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for motion hearing.  Attorney Bricco is requesting that witness provide DNA sample.  Court states it does not have any authority to order such witness to provide a DNA sample.   State makes statements/responses to such request.  Court denies defense's request to compel DNA sample.  Court states that Defense is free to have DNA sample collected voluntarily by witness and have it analyzed but court has no authority to order sample or have the state intervene.
